page.title: 15CLIFFTOP WALK.
page.content: The Walk begins at Courtstairs Park near Ramsgate. The park has lovely trees which are Holme Oak and Silver Birch. Unfortunately, part of the scenery, the Elm trees, were cut down. SMUGGLERS BARN A reminder of smuggling days are the first built smugglers cottages at Pegwell Village and have become a famous part of Pegwell Bay. Pegwell is also famous for its shrimp paste.The lids from the jars of paste have now become a collectors' item one even being found in the sewers in the capital of Australia! PEGWELL VILLAGE PLEASURE GARDENS Unfortunately, all that is left of the village is a car park and a wasteland just by the cliffs. There were at one time just below the cliff Victorian Pleasure Gardens and a pier. Continues on Page 16
